Earn points to increase your rank and unlock rewards. You can earn points by completing Pass Tasks or the various accomplishments listed here. Any rewards you earn for completing a Pass Task will be awarded as soon as you finish the task. The GO Pass feature is currently being tested, and both the free and paid versions of the GO Pass and its rewards can only be earned and claimed in the parts of the world that are eligible for the test.
This reward is available with the deluxe version of the pass.

Deerling and costumed Pikachu caught from Field Research tasks may have an exclusive Location Background
Do you really want to transfer your only {0}?
Aha, %PLAYERNAME%! Your timing couldn’t be better! Tell me—have you noticed anything unusual about your shadow lately?
Several Trainers across the region claim to have seen something strange going on with their shadows.
I’m pretty sure the reports align with something I put down in my older research, but I have to find my notes before I can confirm my theory.
If you’re up for it, let’s go with a tried-and-true play: I’ll search my archives, and you can go out and investigate. Your field observations could prove invaluable!
Yo, %PLAYERNAME%! You looking for the prof? He just bolted by a second ago. He had a big old notebook with him!
The vibes around here have been mega off lately, what with all the weird shadows creeping people out! I mean, not that I’m scared or anything. I’m cool like a cucumber, you know?
But hey, if you wanted to take a break from shadow-hunting, we could hang a bit, trade some battle strats, maybe grab a quick snack?
No? Yeah, I guess you’re right, finding Professor Willow is probably the priority!
Greetings, %PLAYERNAME%. I see my appearance has caught you off guard. Rest assured, you did not startle me.

You’re looking for Professor Willow, correct? I saw him moments ago, though his behavior was somewhat...unusual. It looked as though he was tracking something through the shadows, off in that direction.
These shadowy anomalies you’ve likely heard about—I’ve been studying them myself, though my observations have yet to yield definitive conclusions.
Perhaps your own investigation will prove more fruitful. But be cautious, %PLAYERNAME%.
Oh, %PLAYERNAME%! You after Professor Willow, too?
You know all these weird shadows? They’re no random occurrence. There’s something moving through them. Something interesting.
While Blanche is doing the analyzing thing and Spark is jumping at every shadow, I say you and me tackle this thing head-on!
Just remember, keep that fighting spirit burning, %PLAYERNAME%! Whatever’s out there is testing us!
Found you at last, %PLAYERNAME%! We must’ve been walking right past each other in all these shadows.
I’ve cross-referenced our recent field data against my old notes, and I managed to identify the source of these mysterious occurrences!
A powerful presence is out there, observing Trainers and their Pokémon. Based on the data, it should be nearby, too.
We’re looking at a massive research opportunity here—and you’re the perfect Trainer for the occasion!
Get out there and investigate the thing that’s causing all these odd shadows—but remember to be careful. We don’t know for sure what lies in the darkness!
The strange shadows were actually the Mythical Pokémon Marshadow, hiding in plain sight! Well, plain-ish.
Following its trail through the darkness got us closer than we realized, but it took someone with your special connection to Pokémon to finally draw it into the light.
This is a significant moment! You’ve not only solved the mystery of the shadows—you’ve also gained a powerful new friend in Marshadow!

We might even find some clues about this Dragonite paradise!
Wow, %PLAYERNAME%! You went looking for Litwick and came back with a lamp!
So, let me tell you about Lampent! While it often pretends to be a lamp, Lampent is usually feared as an emissary of death.
Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen. Spooky, but appropriate for the season!
You are deserving of praise, Pokémon Trainer. But our efforts cannot end here.
The full-power attacks I’m working on will make Team GO Rocket unstoppable. What’s with that look? Don’t believe it?

If you have started a stamp rally, a stamp icon will appear in the menu on the right side of the screen. Tap this icon to easily check your progress.

Some stamp rallies allow you to collect stamps with help from your friends. You can send and receive Gifts from PokéStops with stamps—if you are a {0} or higher with the other Trainer, the recipient will be able to collect the stamp from the Gift, wherever they are!
There you are, %PLAYERNAME%! It looks like Kubfu is working hard under your expert eye.
I imagine it’s very diligent when it comes to training both body and mind. But watch out—soon, the student may become the master!
On that note, every master-in-training should know their strengths and weaknesses. What do you think those are for Kubfu?
Let’s discuss that when you return from your next training session. Good luck!
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! Have you discovered Kubfu’s strengths and weaknesses?
Kubfu is a Fighting-type Pokémon, so it’s strong against Normal, Ice, Rock, Dark, and Steel types.
On the other hand, it may have a hard time against Flying-, Psychic-, and Fairy-type attacks. Self-awareness is an important part of mastery!
Thanks to you, it seems Kubfu is learning how to forge its way forward. Keep powering up!

This Timed Research, which challenges you to complete Field Research tasks, leads to encounters with the featured Pokémon of your choice: Teddiursa, Cubchoo, Pancham, or Stufful!

During the event, Pokémon encountered in this Timed Research have the same chance to be Shiny as those encountered via Field Research.

This Timed Research will be available on March 29, 2025, from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time.
Includes: • Collect up to an additional 4,000 Max Particles from Power Spots and exploration • 2× XP for successfully completing Max Battles • Timed Research that awards a Max Mushroom and 25,000 XP

Included bonuses: • Eight additional Raid Passes from spinning Photo Discs at Gyms • Increased chance to receive Rare Candy XL from raids • 50% more XP and 2× Stardust for successfully completing raids

This Pokémon can change forms with Sword Energy, and if they know the Charged Attack Iron Head. You can get Sword Energy by defeating Crowned Form Zacian in Raids.
This Pokémon can change forms with Shield Energy, and if they know the Charged Attack Iron Head. You can get Shield Energy by defeating Crowned Form Zamazenta in Raids.
